sense.def:
To regard something or someone with favour
pomeni, da nam je nekaj ali nekdo všeč in ga podpiramo.

seg.quote: I think the company will look with favour on your plan.
Is this just an attempt to win his favour?

sense.def:
To do someone a favour
pomeni za nekoga nekaj narediti, čeprav ni nujno.

seg.quote: I've come to ask a favour.

sense.def:
To favour something
pomeni nekaj imeti rajši kot drugo, kar je na izbiro.

Kadar nekaj
favours a person or event
, neki osebi olajša uspeh ali omogoči, da se nekaj zgodi.

seg.quote: The weather favoured the attacking army.

sense.def:
To favour someone
pomeni z nekom bolje ravnati kot z drugimi.

seg.quote: Parents may favour the youngest child in the family.

sense.def:
To favour someone with one's attention or presence
pomeni nekomu nakloniti pozornost ali navzočnost;

seg.quote: The minister favoured us with an interview.

sense.def:
Kadar je človek
in favour of something
, misli, da je tisto dobro.

seg.quote: They are in favour of reforming the tax laws.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
makes a judgment in someone's favour
, razsodi, da ima tisti človek prav.

seg.quote: The umpire ruled in her favour.

sense.def:
Kar je
in someone's favour
, nekomu daje prednost.

seg.quote: The system is biased in favour of young people.

sense.def:
To reject one thing in favour of another
pomeni, da zavrnemo prvo stvar in v zamenjavo storimo ali izberemo drugo.

seg.quote: The plans for a new airport have been scrapped in favour of an extension to the old one.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
in favour
, je ljudem všeč ali tisto zagovarjajo. Kadar je nekaj
out of favour
, ljudem ni več všeč ali tistega ne zagovarjajo.

seg.quote: Their views are very much out of favour now.
